did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Joseph L. Zazyczny collection of American Council for Polish Culture records

repository.label: Location:
repository.corpname: Connecticut Polish American Archives, Elihu Burritt Library, Central Connecticut State University

did.abstract: Collection consists of records compiled by Joseph L. Zazyczny related to American Council for Polish Culture (ACPC). Mr. Joseph Zazyczny was the ACPC president from 1987-1989. The bulk of the material covers the years 1984-1989. It includes also materials from annual state conventions, extensive correspondence and documentation of the Washington project, which was a major undertaking of the council in 1980's that went well into 1990's. The main goal of the Washington project was to establish ACPC presence in Washington to promote Polish culture on the national and international level. The collection also includes also information about affiliated members and their activities.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The American Council for Polish Culture (ACPC) was established in 1948 under the name American Council for Polish Cultural Clubs (ACPCC) to represent on a national level the interest of many Polish American cultural organizations that already existed in the United States. The oldest cultural organization, the Polish Arts Club of Chicago, was established in 1928. Currently the ACPC has about 250 members and accepts individual and organizational members. The main mission of the organization is to support a network of organizations to promote Polish language, art, history, and cultural involvement and awareness. The name change from The American Council for Polish Cultural Clubs (ACPCC) to The American Council for Polish Culture (ACPC) was proposed in 1987 and become official in 1988 and still is the official name. And yet another name change occured, however short, during Blanka Rosenstiel presidency(1984-1986)to the American Council of Polish Cultural Organization (ACPCO)to reflect the change in mission of the organization. However it did not receive acceptance from all members. The name American Council for Polish Culture (ACPC) is an official name of the organization. All three versions of the name are in use in various folders description but it is still the same organization.

Joseph L. Zazyczny was born in 1935 in Philadelphia, the son of John and Mary Zazyczny. He attended Catholic elementary and secondary schools in the city and later attended Alliance College, the University of Colorado, and Temple University. In 1967, Joseph Zazyczny was elected to the Philadelphia City Council. His district was made up of a large number of Polish American citizens. Mr. Zazyczny was both Founder and President of the Polish Heritage Society of Philadelphia, a group dedicated to promoting Polish culture through art, language, and music programs. He also served as President of the Polish Intercollegiate Club, an organization of local Polish American college graduates that encouraged local Poles to pursue their higher education. Mr. Zazyczny helped to foster achievement and recognition of many Polonia organizations. He was member of American Center of Polish Cultural Clubs (ACPCC), and first become one of its national directors and in 1987 was elected its President.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: American Council for Polish Cultural Clubs (ACPCC) was founded 1948 ACPCC changed its name to American Council for Polish Culture in late '80s. Jozef Zazyczny was one of national directors and in 1986 become president of the organization. The collection consists of records related to ACPC activities from 1970 till 1989, however the bulk of the material covers years 1984-1989 during intense involvement of Mr. Zazyczny. Material from the conventions includes official publications, related correspondence, various reports, press clippings and information on convention preparation activities. Material related to the Washington projects illustrates the initial discussions, establishing committee and extensive fundraising efforts for the project, and related correspondence. Remaining material in the collection relates to ACPC involvement with establishing scholarships, organizing concerts and lectures as well as gaining new members and attracting young members for the organization.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as: Joseph L. Zazyczny collection of American Council for Polish Culture records (CPAA 99-15). Connecticut Polish American Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

acqinfo.p: Donated by Mr. Joseph Zazyczny in 1990.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material in the collection is arranged in five series and foldres witin each series are in chronological order:
Series V ACPC Members and affiliates, 1981-1989

dsc.p: [The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.]
